intro: Centaurea achaia, commonly known as the Achaean knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with purple markings, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea achaia is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
